intro: Withania obtusifolia, commonly known as the Indian ginseng or ashwagandha, is a herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of India, Pakistan, and Afghanistan. It is characterized by its branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Botanically, it belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants.
